member.summary: Abstract control for creating a 1 to 1 "picker" for any collection object that implements ICollection.

member.name: T:SqlAdmin.NativeMethods
member.summary: Primary Interop class. COM methods not used are primarily prefixed with Bogus. For information on how to extend this class please post to the support forum. There are some interfaces and classes in this file that are not used implemented throughout the application.

password

member.name: T:SqlAdmin.SqlColumn
member.summary: Represents a SQL column.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlColumn.ColumnInformation
member.summary: Gets or sets the column information.
member.remarks: When setting the column information, the table will be internally recreated, and certain table properties such as foreign keys and indexes will be lost. The primary key, however, will remain intact.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlColumn.Table
member.summary: The SqlTable to which this column belongs.

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlColumn.Remove
member.summary: Permanently removes this column from the table.
member.remarks: If there are dependencies on this column other than a primary key or a default, the operation may fail.

member.name: T:SqlAdmin.SqlColumnCollection
member.summary: A collection of SqlColumn objects that represent the columns in a SQL table.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlColumnCollection.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of columns in the SqlColumnCollection.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlColumnCollection.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the columns in the SqlColumnCollection can be modified.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlColumnCollection.IsSynchronized
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether access to the SqlColumnCollection is synchronized (thread-safe).

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlColumnCollection.SyncRoot
member.summary: Gets the object that can be used to synchronize access to the SqlColumnCollection.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlColumnCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a SqlColumn object from the SqlColumnCollection collection at the specified index.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlColumnCollection.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a SqlColumn object from the SqlColumnCollection collection that has the specified name (case-insensitive).

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlColumnCollection.Add(SqlAdmin.SqlColumnInformation)
member.summary: Adds a new column to the table with specified column information.
member.param: The column information for the column to add.
member.returns: If the operation succeeded, the return value is the column created.

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlColumnCollection.CopyTo(System.Array,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the items from the SqlColumnCollection to the specified System.Array object, starting at the specified index in the System.Array object.

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlColumnCollection.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an System.Collections.IEnumerator interface that contains all SqlColumn objects in the SqlColumnCollection.
member.returns: A System.Collections.IEnumerator interface that contains all SqlColumn objects in the SqlColumnCollection.

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlColumnCollection.Refresh
member.summary: Updates the SqlColumnCollection with any changes made since the last call to Refresh. Refresh is automatically called once when the SqlTable.Columns collection is read.

member.name: T:SqlAdmin.SqlColumnInformation
member.summary: Represents the properties of a SQL column such as name, data type, and size.

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlColumnInformation.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SqlColumnInformation class.

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlColumnInformation.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SqlColumnInformation class.
member.param: The name of the column.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SqlColumnInformation class.
member.param: Indicates whether this column is part of the primary key.
Indicates whether this column is an identity column.
The name of this column.
The data type of this column.
The size of this column.
The size of this column.
The precision of this column.
Whether this column allows nulls/
The default value of this column.
If this column is an identity column, the seed for this column.
If this column is an identity column, the increment for this column.
If this column is an identity column, whether this column is a Row GUID column.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlColumnInformation.Key
member.summary: Indicates whether this column is part of the primary key.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlColumnInformation.Identity
member.summary: True if the column is an identity column.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlColumnInformation.Name
member.summary: The name of the column.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlColumnInformation.DataType
member.summary: The data type of this column.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlColumnInformation.ColumnDbType
member.summary: return Column DbType

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlColumnInformation.Size
member.summary: The size of this column.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlColumnInformation.Scale
member.summary: The maximum number of digits that can appear to the right of the decimal point for values of this column.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlColumnInformation.Precision
member.summary: The maximum number of digits for values of this column.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlColumnInformation.Nulls
member.summary: True if a column can contain null values.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlColumnInformation.DefaultValue
member.summary: The default for this column whenever a row with a null value for this column is inserted into the table. Defaults that contain strings must be enclosed in single quotes, e.g. 'hello'.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlColumnInformation.IdentitySeed
member.summary: The seed value of an identity column. This option applies only to columns whose Identity option is set to True.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlColumnInformation.IdentityIncrement
member.summary: The increment value of an identity column. This option applies only to columns whose Identity option is set to True.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlColumnInformation.IsRowGuid
member.summary: Indicates whether the column is used by SQL Server as a ROWGUID column. You can set this value to True only for a column that is an identity column.

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlColumnInformation.Clone
member.summary: Creates a copy of this SqlColumnInformation object.
member.returns: Returns a new instance of the SqlColumnInformation class.

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlColumnInformation.ToString
member.summary: Returns the name of this column.
member.returns: Returns the name of this column.

member.name: T:SqlAdmin.SqlDatabase

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlDatabase.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the database.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlDatabase.Server
member.summary: The server on which this database resides.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlDatabase.Size
member.summary: The size of the database in megabytes. A size of -1 indicates that the user has insufficient permissions to see the size of the database.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlDatabase.Users
member.summary: Gets a collection of SqlUser objects that represent the individual users of this database.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlDatabase.DatabaseRoles
member.summary: Gets a collection of SqlDatabaseRole objects that represent individual roles of this database.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlDatabase.StoredProcedures
member.summary: Gets a collection of SqlStoredProcedure objects that represent the individual stored procedures in this database.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlDatabase.Tables
member.summary: Gets a collection of SqlTable objects that represent the individual tables in this database.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlDatabase.SqlDbTypeDictionary
member.summary: List all possible sql dbtype

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlDatabase.GetDatabaseProperties
member.summary: Gets the properties of the database. These properties include database status, owner, create date, file properties, and more.
member.returns: The properties of the database.

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlDatabase.Query(System.String)
member.summary: Runs a batch of SQL queries on the server using this database.
member.param: A string containing a batch of SQL queries.
member.returns: An array of DataTable objects containing grids for each result set (if any)

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlDatabase.Remove
member.summary: Permanently removes this database from the server.

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlDatabase.Script(SqlAdmin.SqlScriptType)
member.summary: Generates a Transact-SQL command batch that can be used to re-create the SQL database.
member.param: A SqlScriptType indicating what to include in the script.
member.returns: A string containing a Transact-SQL command batch that can be used to re-create the SQL database.
member.remarks: The valid SqlScriptType values are: Create, Drop, Comments.

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlDatabase.SetDatabaseProperties(SqlAdmin.SqlDatabaseProperties)
member.summary: Sets data file and transaction log file properties for this database.
member.param: A list of properties to set.
member.remarks: Only the data file and transaction log file properties are used. You cannot set the owner, create date, etc. properties of the database.

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlDatabase.CurrentDatabase(SqlAdmin.SqlServer)
member.summary: Connects to the CurrentServer and returns the currently selected database. Redirects to an errorpage if the currentDatabase is invalid or null.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlFileProperties.MaximumSize
member.summary: The maximum size of the database in megabytes. A value of -1 indicates unrestricted growth.

member.name: T:SqlAdmin.SqlLogin
member.summary: Represents a SQL Login

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlLogin.Database
member.summary: Identifies the default database for this SQL Server login

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlLogin.DenyNTLogin
member.summary:
Controls access to an instance of Microsoft SQL Server for login records that identify Microsoft Windows NT users or groups.
When TRUE, any Windows NT authenticated connection attempt that specifies the user or group name fails authentication.
When FALSE, the Windows NT user or group is allowed access to the instance of SQL Server on which the login is defined. Access rights are established through login and user role memberships and permissions explicitly granted on databases and database objects.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlLogin.Language
member.summary: Controls direct language use for a client connection using the referenced login.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlLogin.LanguageAlias
member.summary: returns a friendly name for a language used by a Microsoft?SQL Server?2000 login

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlLogin.Name
member.summary: The name of this login.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlLogin.NTLoginAccessType
member.summary: reports whether a Microsoft Windows NT 4.0 login has explicit permissions to connect to a server.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlLogin.LoginType
member.summary: The type of login

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlLogin.GetUserName(System.String)
member.summary: The GetUserName method returns the database user used by the referenced login, when a connection using that login accesses the specified database.

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlLogin.IsMember(System.String)
member.summary: The IsMember method returns TRUE when the user or login referenced is a member of the role identified in the Role argument.

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlLogin.ListMembers
member.summary: The ListMembers method returns a NameList object that enumerates the Microsoft?SQL Server?2000 database roles in which a database user has membership, or the server roles in which a login has membership.

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlLogin.Remove
member.summary: Permanently removes this login from the database.

member.summary: The script should include foreign keys. This only applies to table schema.

member.summary: The script should include unique keys. This only applies to table schema.

member.name: F:SqlAdmin.SqlScriptType.Indexes
member.summary: The script should include indexes. This only applies to table schema.

member.name: T:SqlAdmin.SqlServer
member.summary: Represents a Microsoft SQL Server.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SqlServer class.

The username to connect with
The password to connect with

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SqlServer class.
member.param: The name of the server (e.g. localhost)

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlServer.Databases
member.summary: Gets a collection of SqlDatabase objects that represent the individual databases on this server.
member.remarks: Only databases which the current user has permission to access will be listed.

member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the server to connect to.

member.summary: Gets or sets the password to connect with.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlServer.Username
member.summary: Gets or sets the username to connect with.

member.summary: Collection contains ServerRole objects that enumerate the security administration units

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlServer.Logins
member.summary: Gets Server level logins

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlServer.Languages
member.summary: Contains Language objects referencing the language records

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlServer.LoginSecure
member.summary: Determines if integrated security is used instead of SQL login. False by default.

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlServer.Connect
member.summary: Establishes a connection to the server specified in the Name property.

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlServer.Disconnect
member.summary: Disconnects the connection to the server.

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlServer.GetConnectionString
member.summary: Gets an ADO.NET-compatible connection string for this server.
member.returns: An ADO.NET-compatible connection string for this server.

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlServer.IsUserValid
member.summary: Attempts to authenticate the current username and password to the current server.

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlServer.Query(System.String)
member.summary: Runs a batch of SQL queries on the server.
member.param: A string containing a batch of SQL queries.
member.returns: An array of DataTable objects containing grids for each result set (if any)

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlServer.Query(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Runs a batch of SQL queries on the server using a specific database.
member.param: A string containing a batch of SQL queries.
The name of a database to run the query on.
member.returns: An array of DataTable objects containing grids for each result set (if any)

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlServer.CurrentServer
member.summary: Retrieves a SqlServer instance based on the current user. Redirects to the homepage if one doesn't exist.

member.name: T:SqlAdmin.SqlStoredProcedure
member.summary: Represents a SQL stored procedure.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlStoredProcedure.CreateDate
member.summary: The date and time when this stored procedure was created.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlStoredProcedure.Database
member.summary: The SqlDatabase to which this stored procedure belongs.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlStoredProcedure.Name
member.summary: The name of this stored procedure.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlStoredProcedure.Owner
member.summary: The owner of the table.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlStoredProcedure.StoredProcedureType
member.summary: A SqlObjectType value indicating whether this is a User stored procedure or a System stored procedure.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlStoredProcedure.Text
member.summary: The text of this stored procedure. The text must contain a valid SQL stored procedure creation statement.

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlStoredProcedure.Remove
member.summary: Permanently removes this stored procedure from the database.

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlStoredProcedure.Script(SqlAdmin.SqlScriptType)
member.summary: Generates a Transact-SQL command batch that can be used to re-create the SQL stored procedure.
member.param: A SqlScriptType indicating what to include in the script.
member.returns: A string containing a Transact-SQL command batch that can be used to re-create the SQL stored procedure.
member.remarks: The valid SqlScriptType values are: Create, Drop, Comments.

member.name: T:SqlAdmin.SqlStoredProcedureCollection
member.summary: A collection of SqlStoredProcedure objects that represent the stored procedures in a SQL table.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlStoredProcedureCollection.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of stored procedures in the SqlStoredProcedureCollection.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlStoredProcedureCollection.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the stored procedures in the SqlStoredProcedureCollection can be modified.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlStoredProcedureCollection.IsSynchronized
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether access to the SqlStoredProcedureCollection is synchronized (thread-safe).

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlStoredProcedureCollection.SyncRoot
member.summary: Gets the object that can be used to synchronize access to the SqlStoredProcedureCollection.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlStoredProcedureCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a SqlStoredProcedure object from the SqlStoredProcedureCollection collection at the specified index.

member.name: P:SqlAdmin.SqlStoredProcedureCollection.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a SqlStoredProcedure object from the SqlStoredProcedureCollection collection that has the specified name (case-insensitive).

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlStoredProcedureCollection.Add(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new stored procedure to the table with specified name and text.
member.param: The name of the stored procedure to add.
The text of the stored procedure to add. The text must contain a valid SQL stored procedure creation statement.
member.returns: If the operation succeeded, the return value is the stored procedure created.
member.remarks: The name in the Text parameter must match the Name parameter.

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlStoredProcedureCollection.CopyTo(System.Array,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the items from the SqlStoredProcedureCollection to the specified System.Array object, starting at the specified index in the System.Array object.

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlStoredProcedureCollection.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an System.Collections.IEnumerator interface that contains all SqlStoredProcedure objects in the SqlStoredProcedureCollection.
member.returns: A System.Collections.IEnumerator interface that contains all SqlStoredProcedure objects in the SqlStoredProcedureCollection.

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlStoredProcedureCollection.Refresh
member.summary: Updates the SqlStoredProcedureCollection with any changes made since the last call to Refresh. Refresh is automatically called once when the SqlTable.StoredProcedures collection is read.

member.summary: Get Table Data

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlTable.ScriptData(SqlAdmin.SqlScriptType)
member.summary: Generates a Transact-SQL command batch that can be used to re-create the data in the SQL table.
member.param: A SqlScriptType indicating what to include in the script.
member.returns: A string containing a Transact-SQL command batch that can be used to re-create the data in the SQL table.
member.remarks: The valid SqlScriptType values are: Comments.

member.name: M:SqlAdmin.SqlTable.ScriptSchema(SqlAdmin.SqlScriptType)
member.summary: Generates a Transact-SQL command batch that can be used to re-create the SQL table.
member.param: A SqlScriptType indicating what to include in the script.
member.returns: A string containing a Transact-SQL command batch that can be used to re-create the SQL table.
member.remarks: The valid SqlScriptType values are: Create, Drop, Comments, Defaults, PrimaryKey, ForeignKeys, UniqueKeys, Checks, Indexes.
